perturbation.original_text: For calendar year 2016, the Franchise Fee shall be paid to Grantor on or before March 31, 2017.
perturbation.changed_text: For calendar year 2016, the Franchise Fee shall be paid to Grantor on or before December 31, 2017.
perturbation.explanation: Delaying the payment deadline significantly beyond the immediate subsequent quarter could violate generally accepted accounting principles and potentially state regulations concerning timely payments to municipalities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state regulations regarding timely payments to municipalities and generally accepted accounting principles.

perturbation.original_text: (b) For each succeeding calendar year during the term of this Franchise, the total annual Franchise Fee paid by Grantee to the localities shall be the base year total annual Franchise Fee increased by three (3) percent compounded annually over the term of the Franchise.  For each calendar year during the term of this Franchise, Grantor's percentage share shall be determined pursuant to this Section, and paid to Grantor on or before March 31 of the succeeding calendar year.
perturbation.changed_text: (b) For each succeeding calendar year during the term of this Franchise, the total annual Franchise Fee paid by Grantee to the localities shall be the base year total annual Franchise Fee increased by three (3) percent compounded annually over the term of the Franchise. For each calendar year during the term of this Franchise, Grantor's percentage share shall be determined pursuant to this Section, and paid to Grantor on or before December 31 of the succeeding calendar year.
perturbation.explanation: Extending the payment deadline to December 31 of the succeeding calendar year gives the Grantee almost an entire additional year to make payment. This could violate Virginia state regulations concerning timely payments to municipalities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of Virginia state regulations regarding timely payments to municipalities.

perturbation.original_text: Grantee shall during the term of this Franchise maintain at least one business office within the Territorial Limits of Grantor. Such office shall be open at least forty (40) hours per week for the conduct of business between Grantee and its customers.
perturbation.changed_text: Grantee shall during the term of this Franchise maintain at least one business office within the Territorial Limits of Grantor. Such office shall be open at least ten (10) hours per week for the conduct of business between Grantee and its customers.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the office hours to 10 hours per week may be deemed insufficient to adequately serve the public interest, conflicting with the implied obligation of the franchise to provide reasonable service. This could violate the implicit requirements of the franchise agreement under Virginia law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of the implied requirements of the franchise agreement under Virginia law relating to reasonable service to the public.
